dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 754 IH: All Children are Equal Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania (for himself and Ms. Slaughter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the weighted child count used to determine targeted grant amounts and education finance incentive grant amounts for local educational agencies under title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the All Children are Equal Act or the ACE Act.
Section 1125AA of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6336) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending the heading to read as follows:

section.header: Increase grants per formula student as the percentage of economically disadvantaged children in a local educational agency increases

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (a) to read as follows:
The current Basic Grant Formula for the distribution of funds under this part does not adequately target funds for schools with the highest concentrations of economically disadvantaged students.
The poverty of a child’s family is much more likely to be associated with educational disadvantage if the family lives in an area with high proportions of poor families.

The current formulas for distributing Targeted and Education Finance Incentive Grants is intended to allocate more funds per formula student to local educational agencies with higher concentrations of such students.

These formula use two weighting systems, one based on the percentage of the aged 5–17 population in a local education agency that is eligible to receive funds under this title (percentage weighting), and another based on the absolute number of such students (number weighting). Whichever of these weighting systems results in the highest total weighted formula student count for a local educational agency is the weighting system used for that agency in the final allocation of Targeted and Education Finance Incentive Grant funds.

Since the amount available to be distributed through these formulas is fixed by congressional appropriation, any gain in allocation share by one local educational agency causes a loss to other local educational agencies.

The number weighting alternative is often favorable to very large local educational agencies, even if the agency’s formula student percentage is low. But because smaller local educational agencies simply do not have enough students to gain from number weighting, they are rarely better off under the number weighting alternative.

The Congressional Research Service has compared the funding allocations of each local educational agency for school year 2008–2009 under the current dual weighting system with the funding allocation it would have that year if all local educational agencies had their student count weighted only by percentage weighting.

This data shows that the use of number weighting in these formulas has shifted funding from smaller to larger local educational agencies notwithstanding the level of poverty in either. This is contrary to the intent of Congress, which is to direct more funding per formula student to local educational agencies with high concentrations of poverty, as measured by the number of formula students as a percentage of the aged 5–17 population of the local educational agency.

As a result of this unintended consequence of the number weighting system, 338 of the 340 local educational agencies that have over 38.25 percent formula students gain nothing from number weighting under the Targeted Grant program, 281 of them actually lose funding because of number weighting, and 83 of those 340 highest poverty local educational agencies would actually be better off if Targeted Grant funds were allocated using the Basic Grant formula with no weighting system at all.

Congress has a responsibility to correct this unintended inequity by reducing the power of the number weighting system relative to the percentage weighting system so that local educational agencies with high percentages of poverty but low numbers of students are not disadvantaged under the formulas used for grants under this part.

section.header: Targeted grants to local educational agencies
section.text: Section 1125(c)(2) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6335(c)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking The amount and inserting Except as otherwise provided in subparagraph (D), the amount;
by redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (E); and
by inserting after subparagraph (C) the following:

subparagraph.header: Fiscal year 2016 and each succeeding fiscal year
subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding subparagraph (C) or any other provision of this paragraph—

clause.text: for fiscal year 2016, subparagraph (C) shall be applied—

subclause.text: in clause (ii), by substituting 1.35 for 1.5;
in clause (iii), by substituting 1.8 for 2.0;
in clause (iv), by substituting 2.25 for 2.5; and
in clause (v), by substituting 2.7 for 3.0;

clause.text: for fiscal year 2017, subparagraph (C) shall be applied—

subclause.text: in clause (ii), by substituting 1.2 for 1.5;
in clause (iii), by substituting 1.6 for 2.0;
in clause (iv), by substituting 2.0 for 2.5; and
in clause (v), by substituting 2.4 for 3.0;

clause.text: for fiscal year 2018, subparagraph (C) shall be applied—

subclause.text: in clause (ii), by substituting 1.05 for 1.5;
in clause (iii), by substituting 1.4 for 2.0;
in clause (iv), by substituting 1.75 for 2.5; and
in clause (v), by substituting 2.1 for 3.0; and

clause.text: for fiscal year 2019 and each succeeding fiscal year, subparagraph (C) shall be applied—

subclause.text: in clause (i), by substituting 2,262 for 691;
by striking clause (ii);
in clause (iii), by substituting 1.2 for 2.0;
in clause (iv), by substituting 1.5 for 2.5; and
in clause (v), by substituting 1.8 for 3.0.

subsection.header: States with an equity Factor less than 0.10
subsection.text: Section 1125A(d)(1)(B) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6337(d)(1)(B)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking The amount and inserting Except as otherwise provided in clause (iv), the amount; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.header: Fiscal year 2016 and each succeeding fiscal year
clause.text: Notwithstanding clause (iii) or any other provision of this subparagraph—

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2016, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 2.25 for 2.5; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2017, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 2.0 for 2.5; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2018, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 1.75 for 2.5; and
in subclause (V), by substituting 2.1 for 3.0; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2019 and each succeeding fiscal year, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 1.5 for 2.5; and

subsection.header: States with an equity factor greater than or equal to 0.10 and less than 0.20
subsection.text: Section 1125A(d)(2)(B) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6337(d)(2)(B)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking The amount and inserting Except as otherwise provided in clause (iv), the amount; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.header: Fiscal year 2016 and each succeeding fiscal year
clause.text: Notwithstanding clause (iii) or any other provision of this subparagraph—

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2016, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 3.038 for 3.375; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2017, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 2.7 for 3.375; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2018, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 2.363 for 3.375; and
in subclause (V), by substituting 3.15 for 4.5; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2019 and each succeeding fiscal year, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 2.025 for 3.375; and

subsection.header: States with an equity factor greater than or equal to 0.20
subsection.text: Section 1125A(d)(3)(B) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6337(d)(3)(B)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking The amount and inserting Except as otherwise provided in clause (iv), the amount; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.header: Fiscal year 2016 and each succeeding fiscal year
clause.text: Notwithstanding clause (iii) or any other provision of this subparagraph—

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2016, clause (iii) shall be applied—

item.text: in subclause (IV), by substituting 4.05 for 4.5; and

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2017, clause (iii) shall be applied—
